messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] jcb song
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Danielle, I went into your web site and got excited about  your swamp adventure. I just started unschooling with my youngest son this January.  He is 14
messages.messageBody:
Hi Danielle, I went into your web site and got excited about your swamp adventure. I just started unschooling with my youngest son this January. He is 14 years old and we are deschooling at the moment (stressing for me) he seems so relax now. Back to the swamp Im also going to college myself and took a botany class and we went to a small swamp that UMF and Colby college share for classes. It is not a big swamp such from the picture that you showed us. But there are some unique plants. Im from Wilton, Maine. I will see if my professor will let the homeschooler take a walk down to see it, if people are interested.
Sincerely
Freida

Danielle Conger <danielle.conger@...> wrote: zenmomma@... wrote:

> That is the sweetest song I've heard in a long time. Who is the band?


Nizlopi--British band. The whole album is wonderful, imo, one of my
favorites.

--
~~Danielle
Emily (8), Julia (7), Sam (5)
http://www.danielleconger.com/Homeschool/Welcomehome.html

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

on 3/17/06 9:01 PM, Ren Allen at starsuncloud@... wrote:

> I know you know this, but sometimes it's nice to hear it again.


It's always comforting knowing that there are others out there sending those
kinds of good thoughts your way. All that positive energy in the universe
really does help to manifest what we need/want!

Thanks so much,

love & light,
karen

messages.subject: jcb song
messages.msgSnippet: So, we re moving *back* to Rapid City (from whence we came-the beautiful Black Hills) and really just taking the leap, having faith that the net will appear.
messages.messageBody:
"So, we're moving *back* to Rapid City (from whence we
came-the beautiful Black Hills) and really just taking the leap, having
faith that the net will appear. "

It will Karen!! We did the same when we moved up here....the net is
just starting to appear. I guess we won't end up homeless after all.
HA! Slowly things are coming around and working out great. Follow your
hearts, it will all be great for you in the long run.
I know you know this, but sometimes it's nice to hear it again.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
